definition: just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
the critical moment/life and death crisis
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
